I immediately went back to get the attention of the bar staff and I said that it tasted like water. She rudely took it back and chucked it in the bin in a strop. I do not expect such service from any bar staff anywhere especially when the drinks they were selling were of such poor quality. The replacement Cherry Daiquiri I was given was really no better - it was still its pale, watery self. I am thoroughly disappointed. I was going to recommend this place to all of my work colleagues who work so close to the Queen of Hoxton - now I will tell them to beware. A complete waste of £7.50 for a utterly unsatisfactory cocktail!

title: Great cinematic experience
comment: I went to watch an open-air cinema showing on the rooftop with a friend in the pouring rain. It was a great atmosphere amongst the backdrop of the city! Rugs, ponchos and state of the art headphones were supplied and even though it was very cold, the surround sound in the system meant I was completely engrossed. Staff were very well informed and friendly and the showing started at it's stated time.

title: Rooftop Cinema
comment: Me and my sister decided to go and see 'It Follows' at the Queen of Hoxton to experience the rooftop cinema as we had missed it before in the normal cinemas and this has always been the type of thing we would like to try. It was an experience that I personally think could have been done a lot better.  We arrived at about 8.15 as you are told that anyone not there for the cinema will leave the terrace by 8.30, this was fine, however by 8.30 they begin taking the old chairs away and your just left to stand there cluttered in the corner while you wait for them to be finished. This takes about 30 minutes which can seem like quite a while, while your trying to hold popcorn, a blanket, drinks and some malteasers. The set up of the chairs was appalling, firstly I expected a type of deck chair type of seating but instead there was something less comfortable.  Once they had finished setting up, a man shouted 'ok go' so everyone began to make a dash for the chairs like we were in school. They were so close together and if you are small like me this made it incredibly hard to actually see the film without peoples heads been in the way. The girls in front of me were drunk and continued to take snapchats of themselves while watching the film which meant every so often I would just be staring at the back of two heads. Beware if you are a non smoker, we had a man sitting next to us who probably went through about 5 cigarettes while the film was on, he was also becoming quite drunk and fidgety.  Overall it was an experience, it could have been done a lot better. For example, having the chairs set up before anyone for the cinema arrived even if it means closing the terrace for 10/20 minutes. Potentially having less seating, so it was less crammed. Me and my sister both mentioned we would have paid more just for it to be a little more spacious, this would also mean you have more of a chance to actually see the film. I also believe they should have a no phone policy like normal cinemas. I understand its meant to be quite a laidback experience but it would be better for those who actually wanted to see the film, to not hear facebook notifications every 5 minutes and been featured in others snapchats!

title: Love the Queen!
comment: Went there with a large group and they couldn't have made it easier for me to make sure they were all happy. Alotta love for the guys at QOH!! Great vibe- 3 floors. Beautiful x

title: great roof top bar
comment: Great price on drinks especially for london. Great atmosphere very bohemian. Downside was played alot of r n b not really my type of music but worth a visit all the same even just for the rooftop bar.

title: A Nice Date
comment: Watched Predator on the rooftop cinema.  Stuff I liked: -View from the rooftop. -Blanket was given to keep warm. -Staff were very friendly. -Cool interior. -Headset was comfortable/easy to use. Stuff I didn't like: -Uncomfortable seating. -Expensive beer (from around the £4.50 mark). -Was cold, even though I had a jumper/jacket/blanket. 15/06/2015

title: Great cocktails
comment: The place is nothing much, but the cocktail I tried - Holiday romance, a concoction of coconut and strawberry, with a tad of mint - was really delish.

title: Exceptional service and really friendly staff!!
comment: Saturday nights in Shoreditch are busy and hectic at the best of times - BUT my recent experience at the Queen of Hoxton was absolutely brilliant and the service was so prompt and personal...  I was out with a group of girls, and we were standing on the rooftop bar (great views by the way) when I dropped my pendant from my necklace, which is a family heirloom and ridiculously important. It fell straight through the cracks in the floorboards, and within minutes the manager JOSH was there to help. Not only was he reassuring and incredibly patient (despite the crowds filling the club) but he promised me he and his team would life up all the floorboards in the area to search for it, which they absolutely did. It's all too easy to be short and dismissive in loud and demanding situations like that, but Josh and his team could not have bene more polite, friendly and helpful. It's rare to see that kind of service these days, so if you're after a nice drink, or a dance in a great Shoreditch location then go and enjoy yourselves at Queen of Hoxton! Just watch out for the cracks...

title: Crazy Night at the Queen !!
comment: I Went to the Queen with some friends. This place is really nice and the cuban atmosphere of the roof is unique (lots of colors, even an half car !!) ! We shared a jug of Pimms and ate a delicious cubanos sandwich!  Then, at 10, we went downstairs, the bar was a bit crowded but the atmosphere was in! Good music/ dj with some old school songs as everybody like. Very good experience for me and my friends, i will recommended this place for sur ! Also, cocktails are delicious ;)

title: cool place to visit
comment: this was the first place on a afternoon roof top pub crawl that myself and a friend decided to visit.The whole building is very cool and trendy.You need a drink by the time you`ve climbed all the stairs to the roof but it does not disappoint.We went when it had just opened and the crowd there were mixed .We both had a cuban milkshake which was £6 each and really nice .Food smelt good but we didnt eat.The only down side for us is being london we forgot how noisy it could be and it was hard to talk over the sound of emergency services sirens and a annoying helicopter .Its quite a big space but i can imagine it getting very busy.Its worth a visit though.

title: amazing venue!
comment: I went to the queen of Hoxton last week with some friends and had an awesome time! The staff are super friendly and were great in helping us chose one of their house cocktails! Not too expensive for London either! We then went to the rooftop which you have to climb a few sets of stairs but is well worth it when you get to the rooftop! It has a cuban theme and some great views as well as amazing food and some different yet really tasty cuban cocktails! Could definitely recommend this place to anyone!

title: Fun in the sun!
comment: Really lovely rooftop! Particularly in the sun. Not your classic rooftop bar as you cannot see London cause the walls are so high but lots of character and great drinks - recommend the guava rum milkshake! Good prices but slow service. Food is delicious typical bbq meat place.

title: Bouncers are racist and rude! don't go there
comment: We were in the queue to get in and it was getting towards the maximum capacity. They decided to close the queue and bouncer called 'Big Charlie' decided to close the queue right infront of us which was ok but they he decided to let two white people through who were behind us. Was not impressed by his rude explanation and we decided to take our money somewhere else.  Big Charlie should learn how to speak and learn how to do his job properly without be biased!

title: Cool!
comment: Really cool place for a drink, the rooftop bar is especially awesome, though the drinks are a little bit pricey, would definitely recommend!

title: Rooftop terrace
comment: If you are around shoreditch and the sun is shinning, Queen of Hoxton is the place to come for a drink on their rooftop terrace. Some evenings they use it as a cinema with their big screen. Downstairs there is a small club but music is good in a nice atmosphere

title: filthy toilets - no water - over crowded
comment: I have been to the Queen of Hoxton a few times now, the most recent visit will certainly be the last. the queue to get in was long, the staff were rude, once we got in after paying an entrance fee we had to wait to order a drink for ages. The queues for the toilets took even longer, only to discover, overflowing disgusting toilets with no running water! the toilets didn't flush the entire night and the taps had no running water either. We complained twice to bar staff who just acted confused and uninterested and carried on with what they were doing, one even commented, its always like that, im not sure what that is supposed to mean, but im surprised it is allowed operating without running water? There was actually a tap behind the bar that was constantly running over ice and dirty glasses, but then nothing in the toilets.

title: A fun, funky work do!
comment: Visited here for the first time for my work do. It's pretty average inside, but we had our own private section of the bar, thankfully, with an entertaining ukelele group. There were no drinks on tap nor anything decent in bottled, except for cider. The cocktails were pricey, but nice, though. Ping Pong table lost its little white ball, so my colleague & I ended up with a little blue ball, which we couldn't even see, so it spoiled the game. At least it was only a £5 deposit. Toilets were clean. Good. We went upstairs for a BBQ, which was delicious, and the mulled spiced rum was worth walking up all those stairs to Mount Doom. Fire pits were so warm. Great for burning marshmallows & lighting cigarettes. Overall, it was a greatly enjoyable night!

title: Fun and crazy place, but nice.
comment: Recently had a few (too many) drinks here. Great place with good selection and friendly staff. Will return.

title: Give it a miss
comment: Went for their promoted Australia Day party and it was a huge let down. The supposed "ultimate Aussie burger" took 15 mins to line up for as did every drink, then 10 mins in the BBQ line, then told to come back in 10 mins to collect my tiny dinner roll with an ostrich patty and lettuce nothing else. Also no sign of the countdown that was supposed to be playing. Staff avoided the questions when we asked. Kind of ok vibe but there's way better options. Wouldn't recommend.

title: Been a while I have been to such a rubbish place
comment: The crowd, the place, the bar. All rubbish. You can't take your drink to the roof garden. Don't even get me started on the roof garden. Someone stole my drink (it was 3/4 full). Ordered another beer and it tasted like water. Got it replaced by nagging a lot. The replacement drink made me nearly sick after few sips. Come on people, there are many other places that serve a lot better drinks in the area. And its not like drinks are cheap in this club (compared to the rest of the standard it offers, of course).

title: Gospeloke at Queen of Hoxton
comment: This monthly sing a long night is the best fun Ive had in ages. A full on gospel choir providing backing vocals so even the most tone deaf singer can karaoke away without a care in the world as the fantastic singing troupe behind make everything sound wunderbar. This fun venue is so close to the city but not full of suits. Clean loos. Friendly staff. having read some of the other reviews here they have obviously taken notice of the comments and made some changes.

title: Extremely rude bouncers
comment: It was my friend's bday and 15-20 of us had really bad experience with the bouncers here. They treated everyone like animals. We are not fussy, but these guys really hate their job (except a guy called Sunny I think and a lady that was standing outside).

title: Hated every thing about It.
comment: Rude staff, Rude security, rammed with people to the point where you can't even walk. They just keep letting more and more people in. Friend came here for her birthday however none of us had a good time due to the rudeness of people and staff so we stayed for an hour and left to go somewhere else. Toilets queue were long, there were no toilet tissue and there were no water in the taps to wash your hands. Would never return even if they paid me.

title: Evening ruined by bouncers
comment: After travelling a long way to come to the queen of hoxton we was rudely rejected entry by cocky bouncers who said we can't come in as we were a group of six boys and had no girls. They had no interest in listening that we had traveled a long way to come and repeatedly told us to move away. I would not advise anyone to visit somewhere that don't care about you and are able to carry on laughing after they have ruined people's nights.

title: Humiliated and discriminated against by bouncers
comment: What was planned as a fun night for my brother in law's birthday, turned into a night of humiliation because of the bouncers. Together with a group of friends, amongst which my brother in law who was celebrating his bday, we decided to go to Queen of Hoxton as I had been there before and had fun. We were told to go in the queue if we didn't have reservations and as I was the first one in the queue from our group, I showed my I'D, si did my girl friend behind me, after which we were asked how many of us we were, we said 5 and we were told by the bouncer that it was a private event and because we did not have reservations, we couldn't go in. Funny enough he only decided that after having seen our Romanian IT'S. When we challenged him in the kind of "pruvate" party, the second bouncer started becoming aggressive with us and told us that we will not be allowed in because I was being aggressive (by asking them why we can't go in when everyone else in the queue was allowed in, even though none of them had reservations) and that they worry if someone says something to me in the bar, I would start a fight ( I barely weight 52 kg and measure 1.65m). A lady who heard the conversation and who had organised the entertainment programme for the night heard the conversation and said to us it wasn't a private party and the bouncers should let us in, then tried to get us in and the bouncers said they will not let us in. The manager came outside as well and instead of first listening to us, being the customers and the ones humiliated in front of everyone there, he had a good 10 min char with the bouncer and came to tell us the same story that the bouncer started: what if we were going to start a fight in there. He finally listened to our story as well and he apologised but instead of letting us in, he went on the other side of the street with the bouncer to "investigate".  I have been to many clubs and bars in London and worldwide, but never before I was not let in because of my nationality. It's a shame that this still happens in London in the 21st century. After having read previous reviews of the place, I'm disgusted to see that there have been other people having incidents with the bouncers there and that the management is doing nothing about it. This shows that they don't care about their reputation nor their customers. Never ever I will go back there and I will make sure that every possible website where this place is on will have a copy and paste of my review from here.

title: Shame that it was ruined by the staff
comment: I find that the queen of hoxton is in general a fun night, but I was disappointed today to find that the staff were rude and obnoxious. A real shame to have what could have been a decent experienice ruined

title: Cool nightclub
comment: There's a rooftop, which was closed unfortunately except for the smokers...walking a million steps to get there, which was good, cause I stopped smoking that night haha. The bar itself is quite big, there's a downstairs as well, super warm in there, but good music. Same goes for upstairs. Lots of standing tables but also plenty of room to dance. Nice variety in people as well.

title: Very disappointing - avoid!
comment: I went there for a birthday. The music was awful, no acts turned up, the bar service was slow, the roof terrace was closed at random intervals and when we were finally allowed up it was completely cordoned off and dead. Staff were completely unhelpful. Avoid!

title: Badger fest aye aye!
comment: Their badger fest was lots of fun with lots of good food and reasonably priced drinks. We loved the Photo Booth and the live band. A Queen indeed!

title: Great place! Fun for birthday celebrations!
comment: A group of 11 of us visited here on Saturday for my birthday celebrations it a great place with a good atmosphere. The two rooms was great as they provided different music to choose from.  A special mention to one of the doorman (who's name I have not got unfortunately) at the end of the evening he ensured we were able to sort out transport home before asking us to move on so a big thank you to you! Only issue to mention is the bar was very busy, we would have spent a lot more if the queue hadn't been as long!  Overall great place!

title: Tippity top roof top
comment: If you find yourself in shoreditch, thinking 'I really want to go camping and have some awesome hot alchomaholic cocktails' your incredibly esoteric taste has now been met. The roof top of the queen of hoxton boasts a Tippity top roof top bar called 'wigwambam' With a massive teepee, open fire pits and the best hot cocktails I've had in a long long time. Best enjoyed with a group of mates, and about £30 of spending cash, you'll have a great time here.  Apart from there being very few places to sit, it's the perfect place to while away a cold winter evening!

title: Very trendy , roof bar = nice tent with BBQ, mid is pop/r n b/down is garagey
comment: Went here with friends tonight, cocktails about 8quid, roof bar nice views and heated from bbq inside teppee. downstairs photobooth an ping pong until it turns into dance floor. will go again 3,50 a shot of sambuca, most cocktails 8 the roof is up 8 flights of stairs , as in two then two then two then two so heels may be a bit mean to you. Also upstairs is these little hut toilets, nice enough but as a guy I have never qued for a toilet before we were all shocked. girls laughed

title: Big expectations, very disappointed
comment: We'd heard a lot of good things about this place, but were really disappointed. The main rooms were odd - the ground floor the stair-case in the middle, which took up most of the space, making little room to dance. The basement was similar, and very overcrowded, especially when someone threw up on the stairs and no one was allowed up/down. The toilets were horrific, the worst I've ever seen in any bar/ club - just 5 cubicles, none of which had loo-roll, 2 of which were blocked to the point of almost flooding, the whole room smelt like a sewer, and to top it off - NO RUNNING WATER from any of the taps?! Dozens of girls were just peeing and then leaving with dirty, unwashed hands, it was disgusting! Considering we had to pay entry, we should have asked for our money back. The only good thing was the free-lollipops handed out by staff at the end.

title: WigWamBam in Woodlandia - Why not
comment: We went for the Woodlandia pop-up and it was great. The rooftop bar was lovely, nice enough food from the open grill (the friendly female chef was run off her feet, poor lass - no one appeared to be helping her). We loved buying marshmallows and roasting them on the fire, and the hot festive cocktails -eggsnog (a house eggnog) hot toddy etc were yummy.  The set up was great, bark on the floor, log seats, open fires, all giving it a cosy Alpine feel. So why only 4/5? There are just a few bits that didn't fit quite right - we had to go to three different places to get our stuff - one bar for cold drinks, one for hot drinks and one for food - meant that we spent most of our time hopping from bar to bar before we could relax.  The staff were friendly but a bit pre-occupied - with their phones, gregarious 'mwah-mwah darling' regulars or whatever came next.  Overall, a really nice effort, and I will definitely recommend this to any of my mates heading down south this December.

title: It's all about the roof garden
comment: This place has one major asset and that's the roof garden, which is set amongst the gleaming office buildings in the city. The roof garden has the atmosphere and decor of a music festival and in the winter there's a large wigwam which provides a cosy and surreal drinking den. I would definitely recommend visiting the Queen of Hoxton but only for it's quirky and unique rooftop hideaway.

title: Cool rooftop
comment: went here with a group of friends on a lovely sunny Sunday afternoon. Looks pretty shabby from the outside but the climb to the roof terrace is worth it. The japanese beer was pretty good and the guy behind the bar was brilliant, Ginger guy sorry didnt get his name, very helpful and knowledgeable. you want to sit in the sun on a roof and drink japanese beer go to the queen of hoxton.

title: Hip and Quirky rooftop bar
comment: Have been to this rooftop bar a few times, the rooftop has a very hip and quirky vibe to it, cute decoration and setting, with skyscrappers in the background. Drinks and food are resonable bar prices.

title: Compares badly to other venues in this area
comment: Visiting London in June, the rooftop here was suggested to me by a friend as a venue for my birthday drinks. It's a rooftop alright but that is about the only positive thing I could say about it. 4-5 flights of stairs to the top, a limited number of bathrooms, tiny crowded bar, absolutely no view, and seemed to attract A LOT of smokers. We went to the bar downstairs after a while and there's not much to write about that experience. Average. Shoreditch has a lot better. I wouldn't bother with the Queen of Hoxton.

title: Ad-hox?
comment: I only wandered into this club because I was invited to an event there. The basement was where I spent most of my time, the dance floor was somewhat epic, besides the herds of hipsters grazing on their G&Ts. The place is called the 'Queen of Hoxton' but it didn't even serve Hoxton Gin, which is the best gin in London. The accessibility of the bar was suspect and we were charged a cover of 7 pounds which was outrageous considering how empty the place was. Yet, the laser show on the bottom floor and the DJ were an excellent synesthetic experience. All in all, not worth seven pounds, especially without decent gin and in the throes of hipster mating season nontheless.

title: Hipster?
comment: a cocktail £12 (double vodka and lemonade= £16)and £5 a beer ( they serve only Japanese beer to pretend to be alternative). I don't like this place at all. 6 floors without lift to arrive on a roof top that serve only Asahi beer. Ridiculous isn't it?

title: Rooftop is great in summer
comment: nice place to have a few drinks on the roof after work. Unfortunately, the queues get hideously long for drinks, and when i was there the draught beer (asahi) was stopped as the taps were not working. bit of a let down. food looked good from the bbq, as did the cocktails.

title: Slow service of warm drinks
comment: Headed here on a glorious Friday afternoon, getting in around 5:30, by which time the roof was already pretty full. It only got fuller... and smokier. Drinks service on the roof was very slow and the only beer offering (with the Asahi taps being out of commission) was warm steel bottles of Heineken... which we ended up drinking out of plastic cups with ice. We opted to have our second drink downstairs in the aircon where it was also starting to fill up as there was now a queue to get upstairs. Unfortunately drinks are also served in plastic down here.  Its clearly nailed the setting and this is what attracts the crowds of 20's and 30's and it will continue to pull them in, but, unless we head here for one of the movie nights, we're unlikely to come back

title: Horrible. Go eles where
comment: My cider glass was filthy. Lip stick all over the edge with bit of fruit dryed to the glass. When I asked to replace it he just poured my cider into another glass then toped my cider with beer! Staff need better training. Also they placed my buger ontop of my coleslaw making my burger bun sogie!

title: never go there !
comment: Very bad service !!! The staff is rude ! We went there to go to the rooftop, paid 5£ each to go inside a place with bad music and really expensive drinks. And we were finally told that the rooftop was closed! No refund of course!  Don't waste your money there!

title: get there early for a decent spot on the roof
comment: on a sunny day its a fun place to be but gets crowded quickly. nothing special in terms of drinks so no reason to stay too long either

title: Paid to be kicked out
comment: Bad service - we had to pay to get in - when we specifically said we wanted to go to the rooftodp and only after paying we were advised we couldn't go up. No refund because we reclaimed about the bad service - that's a RIP OFF

title: Kicked out by a touchy matthew horne
comment: I was out for a friends 23rd and it was shaping up to be a good night. Whilst getting a drink at the ground floor bar, i saw this 'DJ' madly twiddling nobs on the mixer channel which was at zero volume. Being a DJ myself i was intrigued, so i watched him for a while. The guy did not even attempt to mix. There was a track running and he literally just played with idle controls whilst dancing about like a moron. I've never seen such a pretentious display of fakery in my life. I've seen some terrible DJ's, but none as bad as this.  I decided to talk to him. A few times i pointed out that he was using controls on a silent channel - no response. I then said he was a crap DJ. When he looked up, i realised it was Matt Horne (the guy from gavin and stacey). I was a little starstruck and stopped what i was doing to go tell my friends. As i pointed him out he was reeling of some trap to the bouncers about how i had assaulted him over the decks. They then grabbed me and took me out. I asked the bouncer why i'd been kicked out, i was told i 'shouldn't have pushed the DJ'. I paid £5 to get into that club and my night was over because Gavin can't accept the fact that he's a poser. The whole situation was hilarious. Seriously matt - stop kidding yourself and stick to the acting & whilst you're at it, don't ruin peoples evenings unnecessarily. Grow up. You're not a princess, and you're certainly not a DJ.

title: Ain't no Queen..
comment: My friend and I decided that to finish out dual birthday eve we would try the queen of Hoxton. Silly idea considering we had never been but we had seen some images and thought it looked worth a go.  The bar was ok. But avoid the cocktail menu as most the ones we tried were super badly done.  Bar staff were nice but the door men are way ott. They wouldn't let us smoke outside on the ground floor. So we had to keep going up insane amounts of staircases to reach the roof terrace, that whilst was cool in ok weather it was pouring with rain plus you couldn't take a drink with you and they had closed the bar up there. Because of this our mate tried to smoke outside downstairs and when she asked the doormen if that was ok and she'd be quick she got kicked out and wasn't even allowed back in to tell us and get her stuff. By the time we realised this, as we thought she was on the roof terrace, she'd gone home!! Total joke!  The basement music was utter rubbish and you could tell this by the lack of people down there. The band was a bad choice. Ground floor music started out ok until a dj came on and continually played the same kinda tunes over and over that you could tell only appealed to the 'spring breakers' in the room. Shame they didn't get the basement going with better tunes.  The crowd is young, and full of bad drunks, pretentious and fixated on trying to be cool but forgetting to have fun.  The toilets are just beyond disgusting with no one looking after them. Literally horrific!!  I'm moaning as most of the QoH is just not my bag, but a little more cleanliness, some common sense from the DJs (check your crowd), another room with alternative music to the main room and lighter touch doormen would dramatically better this place. Oh and ditch the cocktails as you can't make them!  Not for me...

title: Good and bad?
comment: Good music on a Friday night, sometimes on a Saturday too if the DJ is alright. But it gets too hot and crowded later on, is ridiculously overpriced, and as others have said, the staff can be rude (though not all).  The upstairs bar shuts far too early. The system for the smoking area after the upstairs bar has shut is unworkable - I've had my drinks stolen numerous times because they won't let you go up with a drink.  Bouncers tried to block 2 of my friends re-entering the last time we were there, just because they went out front to make a phone call - they had told one of the bouncers what they were doing. So yes, signal can be poor in there, you have been warned. I'd probably give QoH 2 stars, but I've had some good nights in there merely due to good music/DJ and excellent company. PS. if pretentious music and alt bands are your thing, try the downstairs bar.

title: Unprofessional staff, incredibly rude manager
comment: We got tickets for Queen of Hoxton for New Year and overall I actually had quite a good night. Unfortunately, the rude and unprofessional staff ruined it for me. At 11.30, we decided to get a few drinks in ready to toast in the new year at midnight, knowing the bar would be busy. However, we waited for half an hour to get served. Now I appreciate how busy it was, but here was no order at the bar to who was being served; time and again we were ignored by the staff who all crammed at one end of the bar, serving others before us who had clearly only been at the bar a matter of minutes. It was completely random who they picked, and I found this very frustrating. However, we got served just at midnight which, although annoyed at the wait, was simply relieved to get a drink for midnight. Yet halfway through our order, she demanded we pay and wouldn't get the rest of the drinks we'd asked for, saying the bar was shut at midnight for 15 minutes. I was incredibly annoyed about this; how unbelievably unprofessional! I understand bar staff should get a drink at midnight - I have worked New Year's Eve in a bar and didn't get a chance to toast at midnight which was disappointing - but to just cut us off half way through and then walk away was incredibly rude. When I tried to get any other members to complain, they just pointed to the sign that the bar was shut and walked away. Eventually I managed to get hold of the manager and tell him that we shouldn't have been cut off half way through - to which he simply shrugged and said 'oh well' before walking off. He clearly did not care at all. So much for 'the customer is always right'. I worked in several bars across 5 years, so above all common sense, to be dismissed and ignored in such a way was unprofessional, rude and disrespectful. Do not go here until they have a change of manager who actually knows how to treat the customers properly.

title: Rooftop bar makes this place!
comment: First visit to the Queen of Hoxton. We came on a friday evening just as the work crowd was turning up and stayed for a few hours. The bar seemed pretty average but we settled in round a fire pit up on the rooftop. The rooftop is fantastic, we said we'd have to come back in the summer as I can image that's when it really comes alive. Until the next visit!

title: No service?
comment: We went for an after work drink on a Tuesday but didn't get to sample any as there was such bad service. We waited at the bar for 20 minutes (it was particually busy) but no one bothered to serve us. As we got up to leave, someone finally noticed but made no effort to get us to stay. It's got a nice look about the place but can't justify it's prices. It's a shame, I was looking forward to seeing ever the fuss was about. Up your game guys.

title: Very average, shame about the rooftop being closed after 10pm.
comment: Came here yesterday, so a Friday night, heard some great things about the place but it wasn't all that. Wouldn't really recommend going there if you're looking for a clubbing/bar night out. Girls - What to wear: My friends and I arrived at the venue at maybe 11pm-ish, and everyone was very casual. Some people still in their work clothes, shirts and skirts, sandals, ballet pumps, others in jeans and tops. Do not bother wearing dresses/skirts/embellished tops or heels to this venue, it's VERY casual. Vans/Converses are definitely appropriate in case anyone is wondering.  Music: If you're into trancy/house music then downstairs is perfect for you. Lots of strobe lights and all that. The music upstairs is a mixture of current, old school r&b, hip hop but for me personally, it wasn't a consistent stream of good music, enough to keep me dancing all night. And I couldn't really hear what songs were playing sometimes, way too crowded.  PROS: 1. The cloakroom is £1 and bags are free. 2. I ordered a single Vodka orange and it was only £4.50 3. There's a photobooth and for £2 you get 4 photos, printed & e-mailed. This was great! There's also a foosball table but the ball was missing and a pinball machine but I think it was broken or something because no one was using it.  4. There's air-conditioning on the 1st floor, this was so handy as its a very crowded venue. 5. On the right hand side of the venue there is quite a few seats and tables, this again was handy as the dancing area was really crowded. CONS: 1. The girls bathroom was absolutely baking and extremely claustrophobic, only 4 toilets and no toilet paper in all but one cubicle.  2. The music was a little disappointing, a weird combination all mixed together that didn't really flow.  3. The rooftop - the picnic tables, the slushie bar and the swings were all cordoned off. We were told by a member of staff that their license only allows them to have those facilities open from 12pm-10pm. So remember, if you're coming for a night out at QOH, you can't use any of those things. Also you need to climb about 6 flights of stairs to get there. Very disappointing but I understand that's not the venue's fault.  Overall, I wouldn't return to Queen of Hoxton, the music wasn't great and the atmosphere wasn't right, but it all depends on your personal taste. The fact that all the quirky things about the rooftop were cordoned off was really disappointing, after seeing the pictures on here we were really looking forward to it. We didn't have a problem with the staff, they weren't overtly nice but they weren't rude either. The crowd was mid to late 20s, some right doucge bag guys there but again that's not the venues fault. Such a shame really because on paper it sounds like a wicked place, with all its quirky features, but it really isn't all that.

title: I have never been treated so badly by staff in all my life.
comment: Was there to celebrate a birthday, I'm standing at the bar waiting to order drinks, when one of the glorified waiters comes up to me and says "stay away from here, you're too close to these people." Then goes to the women next to me and says "watch your bags" all this while I have my Amex platinum card in hand wearing a £3000 watch!!!!! What a great place. Always good to treat your paying customers as thieves and publicly embarrass them!!

title: Good in the Summer
comment: Brilliant rooftop bar for drinks in the summer or a sunny day but be warned if you are not in the best of shape or have trouble climbing stairs the first time you venture to the roof feels like an endless journey. The selection of drinks on the roof is limited so if your normal is something unusual, ask the bartender downstairs on the ground floor before heading up. Food is fairly basic but well made, after the roof closes which is not really that late in the evening the lower floor can get incredibly packed and a bit of a nightmare to get a drink and the service seems to just take a rapid decline. If Queen of Hox didn't have the rooftop I’d have given it a poor rating, its too expensive for what it is and doesn't really deliver for me.

title: Good rooftop movie ambience, average good and drinks.
comment: Great movie night out at the rooftop. Wireless headsets, good crowd. Blankets provided. Food and drinks are only average though. Locarion is very near liverpool st station.

title: Hipster, Fun, Awesome Roof Space
comment: Quick note to all, I would not say that Queen of Hoxton is a restaurant. What it is is an alternative bar that plays good music, hosts pretty big club nights on Friday and Saturday nights and has a really cool roofspace. Whether it's the 'WigWamBam' (on til end of March!) which consists of an enormous tipi, very cosy, with warm drinks and campfires, the Rooftop Cinema or it's Summer Rooftop Garden, Queen of Hoxton will not fail to entertain. For a more thorough review, check out: http://anthonypulsford.com/2013/02/21/queen-of-hoxton-home-of-hipster-royalty/

title: Rooftop cinema...what's the point...?
comment: Booked some seats for the rooftop cinema...we had food and drinks first and that was good...the burgers were pretty tasty...however, at about 8:30 all non cinema ticket holders are asked to leave...you then have to huddle in a corner whilst they bring out all the seating... They give you cordless headphones...these work well...and there are blankets...there is a canopy overhead...just in case it rains...it is sort of fun but it is not really sociable...I'm glad I went...however, it is unlikely that I will be returning...I'll go to a proper cinema that is warm and where I can take my coat off...

title: errr 'trendy'
comment: pffffffff, bar downstairs, lots of steps to get to roof bar. Once there, its a decent space in the summer with a couple of bars to get drinks from and some BBQ food. Prepare for queues. They do live music of different genres on Friday and Saturday nights and if you're lucky you may find something good, but there's also a lot of dross played there.  This all misses the point though, because its not about the offering, the space and the good times, its one of those places to be seen. Full of trendy kinds who in their desperate attempts to look unique, all end up looking alike. I can't really explain it beyond saying it has a huge middle class projection of 'cool' but if you scrape beneath the surface its just comfortbaly vaccuous. So the actual club trys hard and is ok, there's some originality to what is on show but the superficiality of its patrons is really yuk, dunno how else to explain it. Remember to dress trendy to really make an impact.....

title: Awful
comment: I just have to comment on how rude the staff are at this venue. Walk in to what I can only describe as a youth club for adults. All drinks served in plastic glasses, like they don't trust their customers. The bouncers are all over the place and even after a trek to the roof garden, which is a lot better than the bar area, bouncers still surly. You are treated like an annoying teenager by them (regardless of your age) and I am knocking on a bit! At 10pm your all told you have to leave the roof garden - even on a Friday night and then escorted like cattle downstairs. But not even into the main bar but down into the cellar - I felt like I was at Auschwitz and something untoward was going to happen to us all down there! But no they obviously still wanted our custom so shepherded us into this dingy bar area. Sorry my first route was to find the exit and escape! I will most certainly not be returning to this awful bar as the atmosphere and service of the staff was awful! Don't go unless you would like to be treated in this way! Not me!

title: Cheaper to rent a movie
comment: First time at the Queen of Hoxton, partner and I came to see a film on the roof terrace, was looking forward to having an ice-cream float, as advertised on their website and on the board on the terrace, i was advised these are only served on a tuesday ???, got the impression the bar staff coudn't be bothered, half way through the film I was feeling a little peckish both the popcorn stand and the bbq had now closed. Not the greatest of nights out.

title: The rooftop terrace is worth it
comment: While the bar downstairs is not great, the rooftop terrace is wonderful on summer days/evenings. It's nicely arrange and offers drinks at reasonable prices (for London), although I wouldn't recommend the BBQ. Both the meat and vegetarian burgers were average and pretty pricey.  Still, a nice and breezy open space near the City. The different workshops on offer can also be quite entertaining (I tried the Origami making one and was not disappointed).

title: Awful customer service and brutality of security guards
comment: Last night I visited the Queen of Hoxton for a friends birthday. The bar and club wasn't too bad and we were enjoying a night out in the trendy area of East London. However, several things hapenned at the end of the night which ruined the night for us; Firstly, we were unable to finish the drinks we had brought at 1.55 am (bairmad did not tell us bar was shutting at 2am) and promtly at 2am we were told by the bouncers we had to leave and couldn't finish our drinks. However, the worst thing about the night was the brutality which I experienced first hand from the bouncers. I was assulted by one of the bouncers who used extreme physical force to steal my camera from me because I had filmed them asssulting another punter and pushing them down a steep staircase. I had to wait until the police arrived to retrieve my camera back. The bouncers are aggressive thugs and it ruined the atmosphere.  A very dissapointing end to a friends birthday and definitely not somewhere we will be visiting again (particularly as I later learned from the police this is a regular occurence with the bouncers at this bar).

title: Excellent Place to Drink on a Hot Sunny Day in London
comment: I've just visited this pub for the first time, to attend a leaving 'do' for a work colleague. I was favourably impressed with this place. The staff were professional, friendly, and best of all, they have a fantastic roof terrace, making it the perfect place to go for a beverage on a hot, sunny London afternoon.

title: Good Atmosphere
comment: This is a perfect bar for young people (students and young professionals). The vibe was awesome, the drinks were dirt cheap and delicious, there was a "clubbing" floor and a "bar" floor and there was an awesome smoking rooftop. Definitely make a stop here on a night out. You're guaranteed a good time!

title: Cool roof terrace
comment: Go all the way up the flights of stairs and out onto the roof, where the wigwam bar is. They have transformed the roof terrace to a really cool venue with food on open BBQ and mulled drinks available (try the monkey shoulder and hot fudge!!!). Great place to while away the hours. Just be carefully on he stairs on he way down...

title: Nice Place
comment: Nice roof terrace. Book well in advance if you want to join the cinema on the weekdays. They have sold out 20 days in advance!

title: Great Little Venue
comment: Came tonight for a show. The venue was fantastic. Very lively, even upstairs in the main area was very lively. Downer would be the bartender was quite rude to me when my card wasn't responding in the machine, she was also very rough when sliding it through the strip reader so no wonder why it didn't work.  But as for live music venue it was great, very glad I went .

title: Awesome rooftop...
comment: We went to the Queen of Hoxton for some birthday drinks on a warm, sunny Saturday. We arrived at 2pm, pretty close to when they opened and they were already pretty busy. There is a lot of seating, so getting enough chairs and space for about 15 people wasn't a problem. There isn't much shade at all except by the BBQ and bar, and only enough room for one small table. However, since the sun hardly ever shines in London, this isn't too big of a problem.  Drink prices weren't too bad and the wait wasn't bad at first. The bar is very small and only two bar staff were working so once it got busy, the wait time for a drink was around 15 minutes. The BBQ was a bit pricey and the burger was average at best. Apparently friends who ordered the chicken, thought it was pretty good.  Later in the afternoon it started to rain and since there was no cover on the roof, most people moved downstairs, which is not great. If you are coming to the Queen of Hoxton, come on a sunny day and hit the roof terrace!  All in all, I rate it a very good, because we did have a good time on the roof terrace and would go back on more sunny days.

title: great roof terrace!
comment: Watched 'when harry met sally' a week ago on the roof terrace & absolutely loved it! It's a pity this is only a summer venue and a pity the rainy weather in the UK affects the showings because it was just magical. Fairy lights & flags, cute deck chairs, great outdoor BBQ food, good drinks, great crowd - all in all a very enjoyable evening. I'll be booking early next year!

title: Nice little rooftop cinema.
comment: having reviewed over 26 different rooftop Cinemas, I can say with authority that this was one of the best. Shame it was sooo damn cold.

title: Expensive beers
comment: This bar has a wonderful reputation and I must say I was not that impressed when I went on Halloween FRIDAY night. Firstly the 5 pound entry fee, then 9 pounds for 2 beers (no beers on tap). The floor is so dirty and sticky my shoes got stuck on the floor. The bouncers are a bit to heavy handed, even patting down my male friends. I was outside smoking a hand rolled cigarette I was accused of smoking a joint and told I was not allowed back in. When I pointed out it was a cigarette, he would not believe me and I had to let him smell it and look at my tobacco and have a long discussion about letting me back in, no apology. Inside the atmosphere was very merry, but the DJ was changing from 80's, to current club hits to rock etc very mix mash. Perhaps next time I should check out the movie night on the terrace.

title: Staff did not treat our party well
comment: We had a private party on the rooftop of this bar and I found the staff incredibly rude, especially considering the money they must have got out of us! One of the "bouncers" nearly trapped my arm in the fire door leading to the stairs up to our party as he tried to slam it on my face. He did not even give me a chance to show him my wristband to show that I was allowed up there! This was really dangerous and extremely rude. The cloakroom topped my night off. I have never been to such a disorganised cloakroom in my life. The hatch was so small that only one person could be seen at a time and the "queue" blocked off the whole hallway leading to the toilets. As there were only two members of staff in the cloakroom, we all ended up waiting for about half an hour for our coats when we just wanted to get out of the place!

title: Paradox
comment: Downstairs doesn't look up to much and the stairs up to the wigwam feel like an NCP car park, but what a transformation when you walk through the door! Into the wigwam and out onto the roof terrace to the "beach bar" is great. Will definitely go back.
